Rule suggestion and accuracy checking. \nSUGGEST\n \tLists potential Rules according to shopping history.\n \tADD Adds the Rule.\n \tSKIP Temporarily removes the Rule from the List.\n \tDISABLE Permanently (see DISABLED below) removes the Rule from the list.\n\n CHECK\n \tLists existing Rules with the Rule\'s accuracy according to the Shopping history.\n \tAccuracy is shown as a percentage.\n \t\t100 is exact.\n \t\tLess than 100, the Rule adds too few.\n \t\tMore than 100, the Rule adds too many.\n \tMODIFY Edits the Rule.\n\n DISABLED\n \tList Rules that have been Disabled.\n \tENABLE Enables the Rule.\n\n NOTES\n \tDISABLED (only shown if there are Disabled Entries)\n\n \tMin Period and Min Bought may cause nothing to be shown.\n \tIf Min Bought and Min Period are both 0 then:-\n \t\tResults may be not reliable.\n \t\tSuggest will show all STOCK that does not have an existing Rule.\n \t\tCheck will show all RULES.\n \t\tResults may include NaN (Not a Number) due to divide by 0 handling.\n \t\tIt is inadvisable to rely on low values (hence 30 and 5 as defaults).\n Help // Title &heading; &tab1; &tab2; Main Display - Help &heading;Main Display - Help "" The Main Display displays a list of Buttons which can be clicked to take you to the respective option. "" The full complement of Options are:- &tab1;- SHOPS for Managing Shops (The places where you do the Shopping) &tab1;- AISLES for Managing Aisles (Locations within Shops) &tab1;- STORAGE for Managing Storage (where you keep the purchased Products; e.g. Fridge, Pantry etc.) &tab1;- PRODUCTS for Managing Products (The Items that you purchase see Stock) &tab1;- STOCK for Managing Stock i.e. assigning Products to Aisles within Shops. &tab1;- ORDER for adding ad-hoc Stock to the Shopping List, complements CHECKLIST and RULES &tab1;- CHECKLIST for adding Stock to the Shopping List, by checking Storage; complements ORDER and RULES &tab1;- SHOPPING for displaying the Shopping List whilst doing the Shopping. &tab1;- RULES for managing Rules, that regularly add Stock to the Shopping List (automatically or prompted) &tab1;- TOOLS for utility options, such as backup/restore and rule suggestion/checking. "" At First only the SHOPS, STORAGE and TOOLS buttons are available. Other buttons are made available when the respective data has been added. e.g. An Aisle must be owned by a Shop, so the AISLES button only appears when a Shop has been added. "" The Rules for Button Availability are:- &tab1;- AISLES requires at least 1 Shop. &tab1;- PRODUCTS requires at least 1 Storage. &tab1;- STOCK requires at least 1 Aisle and at least 1 Product. &tab1;- ORDER, CHECKLIST, SHOPPING and RULES require at least 1 Stock. "" &heading;Commonalities "" Names &tab1;Names (Shops, Aisles, Storage, Products, Rules) are limited to 24 characters. Order &tab1;Order is used to order items in the Shopping List and the Checklist. Order is a number (1-9999). Lower numbers appearing first. &tab1;The Shopping List has three tiers of ordering and is thus sorted by Shop, Aisle and Stock. &tab1;The CheckList has two tiers of ordering and is sorted by Storage and then Product. "" Lists &tab1;ShopWise has many Lists. There are two main types of Lists. &tab2; Lists with a heading showing respective data (ListViews); and &tab2;Lists that are displayed when an input field is selected (Spinners or DropDown Selectors). "" &tab1;ListViews &tab2;ListViews will have a heading for the ensuing data. With the exception of fixed order lists, the Shopping List and the CheckList, ListViews can be sorted by clicking on a Heading. Clicking on the same heading again will then toggle the sort order between ascending and descending. "" &tab2;Below the heading and before the Listed Items is a single line used to indicate functionality aspects of the ListView. &tab2;The indicator will show if the ListView is sortable or not, the indicator will show if Items can be clicked and also if they can be long-clicked (no indication means that they cannot). "" &tab2; Clicking or long-clicking an item (if applicable), will result in a Dialog being displayed offering options. &tab2; A Dialog will always have a CANCEL option, which returns to the display doing nothing. &tab2; Clicking displays a Dialog offering the EDIT option and for Shops, Aisles and Products an STOCK option (if the relevant underlying data exists). &tab2; Long-Clicking will display the more critical DELETE option. The Dialog will also include a list of the impacted data (which could be quite extensive, e.g. deleting a Shop would delete all Aisles within the Shop and all Stock within the Aisles etc. "" &tab1;DropDown Lists/Spinners &tab2;These appear when the input field is clicked, clicking an item in the list selects that item and closes the list. "" Aisles Display - Help &heading;Aisles Display "" The Aisles Display allows Aisles; to be Added by clicking the ADD button, Aisles to be Edited or Stocked (if applicable) by clicking an Aisle in the list of current Aisles, or for an Aisle to be deleted by long-clicking and Aisle in the list of current Aisles. "" The Aisles need not be actual Aisles, rather an Aisle is a term used by ShopWise to cover any location where items can be purchased. "" &heading;Buttons "" The ADD button goes to the Aisles Add/Edit display where Aisles can be added. "" The DONE button will return to the Main Display "" &heading;DropDown Selectors "" The Shop field is a DropDown selector allowing the Shop to be changed. &tab1;The List of Aisles shows Aisles in the currently selected Shop. "" &heading;List Actions The Aisle List can be sorted according to a heading (Aisle or Order), clicking the same heading again will toggle between ascending and descending. An item in the list can be clicked, a dialog will appear with options, Cancel, Stock and Edit. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;STOCK is for assigning Products to Aisles, the respective Shop and Aisle will be selected. "" &tab2;STOCK will only be present if at least 1 Product exists. &tab2;Note! Stock can also be accessed via the STOCK option and via the SHOPS and PRODUCTS options. "" EDIT is for changing the details of an existing Shop "" An item in the list can be long-clicked, a dialog will appear with options, CANCEL and DELETE. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;DELETE will delete the Aisle along with items that reference the Aisle. &tab2; Note! referenced items are displayed in the dialog, the list can be quite extensive as all Stock (not Products) and use of the Stock will be deleted.. "" Aisles Add/Edit Display - Help &heading;Aisle Add/Edit Display "" The Aisles Add/Edit Display is used to Add or Edit Aisles. When invoked via Edit the Aisle\'s data fields will be filled with the current data, allowing them to be changed. When invoked via Add the Shop will be set to the Shop that was selected when ADD was clicked, the Aisles\'s name field will be blank. The Order field which will be set to a suggested Order. "" &heading;Buttons "" SAVE &tab1; Clicking SAVE will attempt to save the Aisle. &tab2; If the Aisle cannot be saved an error message (yellow text) will indicate the issue. If the Aisle was saved then a message (green text) will indicate this. "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Aisles Display.. &tab2; Note! Changes will not be applied if made after saving. "" &heading;Fields "" Shop &tab1; The Shop that the Aisle will belong to. &tab1; Must be one of the Listed Shops. "" Aisle Name &tab1; The name of the Aisle (up to 24 characters) used to identify the Aisle. &tab1; Required and cannot be blank. "" Order &tab1; The Order in which the Aisle will appear in the Shopping List, within the owning Shop. &tab1; Lower numbers appear first. &tab1; Required and must be a value between 1 and 99999. &tab1; A suggested number is provided when adding an Aisle. The suggested number will be 1000 for the first Aisle or 100 greater than the highest Aisle Order within the Shop. "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. No actions are available from the List, as this could be confusing due to recursion. "" Backup/Restore Display - Help &heading;Backup/Restore Display "" The Backup/Restore Display is used to create or restore from DataBase Backups. &tab1; Flexibility through the ability to change file naming can also facilitate restoring the Database from other sources. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Tools Display.. "" RESET &tab1; Clicking RESET will change the Date/Time Part to the current Date/Time. &tab2; Note! a change will only appear to be made after at least a minute has elapsed since Backup/Restore was invoked or since last using RESET. "" BACKUP &tab1; Clicking BACKUP will start the DataBase Backup utilising the displayed file name as displayed in theFile Name in Full field. &tab2; A dialog displays the result (Success or Failure). &tab2; Note! it is suggested that the default values in the Base Filename, the Date/Time Part and the File Extension are used. "" RESTORE &tab1; Clicking RESTORE will initiate the DataBase Restore utilising the file selected in the Restore File drop down selector. &tab1; A dialog will appear providing information and asking for confirmation. &tab2; Clicking CANCEL will return to the Backup/Restore Display. &tab2; Clicking CONTINUE will proceed with the Database Restore. &tab2; The result of the Restore will be displayed by a Dialog. &tab2; If the Restore failed then the Database will revert to the Original Database.. &tab2; If the Restore failed the Database will revert to the Original Database.. &tab2; ShopWise will then be restarted in order to ensure that cached data is cleared.. "" &heading;DropDown Selectors "" The Restore File field is a DropDown selector allowing the file to restore from to be changed. &tab1; Note! The DropDown Selector will not be available if there are no restore files. &tab1; Note! The available restore files depends upon the Base Filename and the File Extension fields. &tab2; Note! The data in the Base Filename field, must be contained in the filename for the file to be included. &tab2; Note! The data in the File Extension field, must match the file extension for the file to be included. &tab1; Note! Again it is suggested that the default values be utilised to avoid confusion. "" &heading;Fields "" Backup Directory &tab1; The Backup Director displays where the backups will be stored, it cannot be changed. "" Base Filename &tab1; The Base Filename is the first part of the filename that will be used when clicking BACKUP. It is used in conjunction with the Date/Time Part and also the File Extenesion. &tab1; The Base Filename is also used for determining the available restore files. For a restore file to be included in the Restore File list, the Base Filename must be contained within filename. &tab1; The Base Filename should be provided, however it is not mandatory. "" Date/Time Part &tab1; The Date/Time Part is the second part of the filename an by default is an indication of the date and time of the backup. &tab1; The Date/Time Part should be provided, however it is not mandatory. "" File Extension &tab1; The File Extension is last part of the filename that will be used when clicking BACKUP. It is used in conjunction with the Date/Time Part and also the File Extenesion. &tab1; The Base Filename is also used for determining the available restore files. For a restore file to be included in the Restore File list, the Base Filename must be contained within filename. &tab1; The Base Filename should be provided, however it is not mandatory. "" File Name in Full &tab1; The File Name in Full displays where the file name that will be used if BACKUP is clicked. &tab1; The File Name in Full is the combination of all three parts (Base FileName, Date/Time Part and File Extension. &tab1; File Name in Full is a display field, it cannot directly be changed. "" Available Backups &tab1; Available Backups displays the number of backup files that will be listed/available in the Restore File dropdown selector. "" Restore File &tab1; Restore File is a dropdown selector, allowing selection the file to be used by the restore when clicking the Restore button. "" CheckList Display - Help &heading;CheckList Display "" The CheckList Display is used for adding items(Stock) to the Shopping List by checking what Products are currently stored in Storage. The list is ordered according to Storage order and then by Product order. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Main Display.. "" RESET &tab1; Clicking RESET will reset the CheckList reverting checked-off items to be unchecked.. "" Check-off &tab1; Clicking Check-off marks the respective item as having been checked. &tab1; When Checked-Off the item will be marked as checked-off as the text will be less visible (white instead of black/grey). &tab1; When Checked-Off the Check-off buttons, ADD and LESS, will be replaced by an UNCHECK button. "" UNCHECK &tab1; Clicking UNCHECK reverts the respective item as not having been checked-off. "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will add 1 of the respective Stock to the Shopping List. &tab1; The # in List will be incremented by 1 to reflect how many of the respective Stock are in the Shopping List. "" LESS &tab1; Clicking LESS will remove 1 of the respective Stock from the Shopping List, if any exist. &tab1; The # in List will be reduced by 1, if there were any, to reflect how many of the respective Stock are in the Shopping List. "" &heading;List Actions The list cannot be sorted. Buttons appear for each entry (see above). Each Item in the List has the following fields:- &tab1;Top Row &tab2;Product Name &tab2;Shop Name &tab2;Aisle Name &tab2;Price &tab1;Bottom Row &tab2;Level. The number following Level is how many should be at the storage location before replenishing. &tab2;# in List. The number following # in List is how many are already in the Shopping List. &tab2;Buttons. refer to Buttons above. "" Order Display - Help &heading;Order Display "" The Order Display is used for adding items(Stock) to the Shopping List as and when required. It complements CHECKLIST and Rules with a means of adding to the Shopping List according to Product Name in an adhoc way. &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Main Display.. "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will add 1 of the respective Stock to the Shopping List. &tab1; The # in List will be incremented by 1 to reflect how many of the respective Stock are in the Shopping List. "" LESS &tab1; Clicking LESS will remove 1 of the respective Stock from the Shopping List, if any exist. &tab1; The # in List will be reduced by 1, if there were any, to reflect how many of the respective Stock are in the Shopping List. "" &heading;Fields "" Filter &tab1; The Filter field is for filtering the displayed Stock by Product Name in order to reduce the listed Products to a manageable size for subsequent selection. &tab1; The data entered in the filter will immediately reduce the list of Stock displayed to Stock that contains the data e.g. :- &tab2; Entering a or A (case independent) will reduce the list to only show Stock whose Product Name includes a (e.g. Lettuce would then not appear in the list). &tab2; Entering bak will reduce the list to only show Stock whose Product Name includes bka (Baked beans would appear, Lettuce and Banana would not). &tab2; Filtering can very quickly reduce the list to show the Stock that you want to add. &tab1; No data is required, in which case all Stock will be listed . "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. Buttons appear for each entry (see Buttons above). Each Item in the List has the following fields:- &tab1;Top Row &tab2;Product Name &tab2;Shop Name &tab2;Aisle Name &tab2;Price &tab1;Bottom Row &tab2;# in List. The number following # in List is how many are already in the Shopping List. &tab2;Buttons. refer to Buttons above. "" Products Display - Help &heading;Products Display "" The Products Display is for managing (adding, editing, deleting and stocking) Products. &tab2; Note! ShopWise uses the term Product to refer to the core Product, basically just the name of the Product. a Product assigned to an Aisle within a Shop is termed as Stock. &tab2; Stock has more attributes, such as price and history (date first purchased, date last purchased and number purchased). "" &heading;Buttons "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will go to the Products Add/Edit Display in order to add one or more Products. "" &heading;Fields "" Filter &tab1; The Filter field is for filtering the displayed Products by Product Name in order to reduce the listed Products to a manageable size for subsequent selection. &tab1; The data entered in the filter will immediately reduce the list of Products displayed to Products that contains the data e.g. :- &tab2; Entering a or A (case independent) will reduce the list to only show Products whose Product Name includes a (e.g. Lettuce would then not appear in the list). &tab2; Entering bak will reduce the list to only show Products whose Product Name includes bka (Baked beans would appear, Lettuce and Banana would not). &tab2; Filtering can very quickly reduce the list to show the Stock that you want to add. &tab1; No data is required, in which case all Products will be listed . "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. An item in the list can be clicked, a dialog will appear with options, Cancel, Stock and Edit. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;STOCK is for assigning Products to Aisles, the respective Shop and Aisle will be selected. "" &tab2;STOCK will only be present if at least 1 Product exists. &tab2;Note! Stock can also be accessed via the STOCK option and via the SHOPS and PRODUCTS options. "" EDIT is for changing the details of an existing Shop "" An item in the list can be long-clicked, a dialog will appear with options, CANCEL and DELETE. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;DELETE will delete the Product along with items that reference the Product. &tab2; Note! referenced items are displayed in the dialog.. "" Products Add/Edit Display - Help &heading;Products Add/Edit Display "" The Products Add/Edit Display is used to Add a new Product or Edit an existing Product The display will indicate the invocation type. i.e. Products - Add or Products - Edit will appear as the Title. When invoked via Edit all data will be supplied, it can then be changed as required. When invoked via Add minimal data will be supplied, further data has to be input. "" &heading;Buttons "" SAVE &tab1; Clicking SAVE will save the data unless the data cannot be saved, in which case a message detailing the issue will be shown. If the SAVE is successful a message is shown indicating this. "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Products Display.. "" &heading;DropDown Selectors "" The Storage field is a DropDown selector allowing the Storage to be selected or changed. "" &heading;Fields "" Product &tab1; The name of the Product. &tab1; The Product must be given and can be up to 24 characters in length. &tab1; Note Product also acts as a Filter to reduce the listed Products as you enter data. "" Storage &tab1; The Storage location of the Product, i.e. where the Product is kept. &tab1; Storage must be a selection from the dropdown list. "" Order &tab1; The Order within the Storage that affects where the Product appears in the CheckList. &tab1; Order is required and must be a whole number between 1 and 99999. &tab1; When Adding a number will be suggested based upon the number of Products currently in the Storage location. "" Filter &tab1; The Filter field is used to reduce the listed Products to a manageable size for subsequent selection. &tab1; The data entered in the filter will immediately reduce the list of Products displayed to Products that contains the data e.g. :- &tab2; Entering a or A (case independent) will reduce the list to only show Products whose Product Name includes a (e.g. Lettuce would then not appear in the list). &tab2; Entering bak will reduce the list to only show Products whose Product Name includes bka (Baked beans would appear, Lettuce and Banana would not). &tab2; Filtering can very quickly reduce the list to show the Stock that you want to add. &tab1; No data is required, in which case all Stock will be listed . "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. No actions are available from the List, as this could be confusing due to recursion. "" Prompted Rules Display - Help &heading;Prompted Rules Display "" The Prompted Rules Display is used to accept or decline Prompted Rules. "" &heading;Rule Catchup Rule Catchup is an integral process with rules. Rather than have multiple rules for each future occurrence a single rule exists with a next occurrence date. When a rule is applied the next date is then determined and so on. Rather than have multiple rules for each future occurrence a single rule exists with a next occurrence date. When a rule is applied the next date is then determined and so on. As such a number of occurrences of a rule can be required and applying these is Rule Catchup. Rule Catchup is undertaken seamlessly for automatically added Rules. However, Prompted Rules require manual intervention as that is their purpose. Adding or Skipping a Prompted Rule may result in the next occurrence appearing in the list. &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will go to the Shopping List Display. &tab1; Note! any remaining Prompted Rules will not be skipped or added. i.e. they will remain as will Rule Catchup . "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will apply the rule and add the respective Stock to the Shopping List Display. &tab1; Note! it may, due to Rule Catchup that the ADD did not work. However, it will be because another occurrence of the Prompted Rule is also due. . "" SKIP &tab1; Clicking SKIP will skip applying the rule and thus not add the respective Stock to the Shopping List Display. &tab1; Note! it may, due to Rule Catchup that the SKIP did not work. However, it will be because another occurrence of the Prompted Rule is also due. . "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. No actions are available from the List, as this could be confusing due to recursion. "" Rules Display - Help &heading;Rules Display "" The Rules Display is used for managing Rules Rules can be added, edited or deleted. A Rule is used to add Stock to the Shopping List on a regular basis. "" There are two types of Rules normal(unprompted) and prompted. A normal/unprompted rule will add the item(Stock) to the Shopping List automatically without intervention, while a prompted rule requires that the rule be accepted or rejected(Skipped). The acceptance/rejection being prompted for when invoking the Shopping List. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Main Display. "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will go to the Rules Add/Edit Display. "" &heading;List Actions The Rules List can be sorted according to a heading (Rule, Product Name, Add On or Prompt), clicking the same heading again will toggle between ascending and descending. An item in the list can be clicked, a dialog will appear with options, Cancel and Edit. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;EDIT is for changing the details of an existing Rule, clicking EDIT will go to the Rules Add/Edit Display populating the display with the values from the Rule. "" An item in the list can be long-clicked, a dialog will appear with options, CANCEL and DELETE. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;DELETE will delete the Aisle along with items that reference the Aisle. &tab2; Note! referenced items are displayed in the dialog, the list can be quite extensive as all Stock (not Products) and use of the Stock will be deleted.. Rules Add/Edit Display - Help &heading;Rules Add/Edit Display "" The Rules Add/Edit Display is used to for adding a new Rule or for editing an existing Rule. The title of the Rules Add/Edit Display will indicate how the display is invoked. If invoked via Add the title will be Rule Add, if from Edit the title will be Rule Edit. When adding a rule fields will either be blank or set to default, whilst when editing a rule the fields will be populated with data from the rule being edited.. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the invoking display, this could be the Rules Display or the Rule Suggestion List Display or the Rule Accuracy Check Display. "" Starts (the button actually has a date) &tab1; Clicking the button with the Date immediately to the right of Starts will display a dialog for picking a date. &tab2; The dialog displays the currently selected date with large text. &tab2; The -Month button changes the date to the previous month, (if the day is not in the month (e.g. 29-31 if going back to February), then the last day of the month is selected). &tab2; The +Month button changes the date to the next month, (if the day is not in the month (e.g. 29-31 if going forward to February), then the last day of the month is selected). &tab2; The -Year button changes the date to the previous year, (if the day is not in the month (specifically 29th February), then the 28th of February is selected). &tab2; The +Year button changes the date to the next year, (if the day is not in the month (specifically 29th February), then the 28th of February is selected). &tab2; Below the month/year buttons is the Date Grid. This always shows 6 weeks and will always show days in the previous and next month. &tab2; The currently selected Date is highlighted by a circle. &tab2; Clicking on a Date will change the selected date to that Date. &tab2; If the Date clicked is in another month then that month will be the displayed month. &tab2; Clicking DONE or cliking outside of the dialog will apply the date returning to the Rules Add/Edit display. &tab1; Starts is the date that the Rule will next be applied, it is displayed in the list in the Add On column. "" &heading;DropDown Selectors "" The Shop field is a DropDown selector allowing the Shop to be selected, it is disabled when editing a Rule &tab1; To effect a change of Shop a new Rule should be added and the original Rule deleted. &tab1; Shops that have no Aisles will not be included in the list. "" The Aisle field is a DropDown selector allowing the Aisle to be selected, it is disabled when editing a Rule The listed Aisles are limited to the Aisles in the selected Shop. &tab1; To effect a change of Aisle a new Rule should be added and the original Rule deleted. &tab1; Aisles that have no Stock, if selected, will result in the Product dropdown not being displayed, the SAVE button will also not be available and a message (yellow) will be display indicating the issue. "" The Product field is a DropDown selector allowing the Product to be selected, it is disabled when editing a Rule The listed Products are limited to the Stock in the selected Aisle. &tab1; To effect a change of Aisle a new Rule should be added and the original Rule deleted. "" The Interval field is a DropDown selector allowing the Interval to be selected. The Interval is used in combination with the Multiplier to set the regularity of the Rule. e.g. if Interval is WEEKS and Multiplieris 3, the Rule will be applied every 3 weeks, (the next application being on the Add On date; as shown in the list.. The listed Products are limited to the Stock in the selected Aisle. &tab1; To effect a change of Aisle a new Rule should be added and the original Rule deleted. "" &heading;Fields "" Shop &tab1; The Shop dropdown selector is for specifying the Shop for the that will be applied by the Rule to the Shopping List. &tab1; A Shop cannot not be selected. "" Aisle &tab1; The Aisle dropdown selector is for specifying the Aisle for the that will be applied by the Rule to the Shopping List. &tab1; An Aisle cannot not be selected (Shops that have no Aisle are excluded from the Shop dropdown selector). "" Filter &tab1; The Filter field is for filtering the displayed Stock by Product Name to reduce the listed Stock to a manageable size for subsequent selection. &tab1; The data entered in the filter will immediately reduce the list of Stock displayed to Stock that contains the data e.g. :- &tab2; Entering a or A (case independent) will reduce the list to only show Stock whose Product Name includes a (e.g. Lettuce would then not appear in the list). &tab2; Entering bak will reduce the list to only show Stock whose Product Name includes bka (Baked beans would appear, Lettuce and Banana would not). &tab2; Filtering can very quickly reduce the list to show the Stock that you want to add. &tab1; No data is required, in which case all Stock will be listed . "" Product &tab1; The Product dropdown selector is for specifying the Product for the that will be applied by the Rule to the Shopping List. &tab1; A Product must be selected. &tab2; If an Aisle is selected that has no Stock and thus no Product dropdown selector, then SAVE is disabled, a message will indicate the issue. "" Rule &tab1; The name of the Rule. &tab1; Rule is required and can be up to 24 characaters in length. &tab1; Clicking on SAVE with Rule empty will result in a message indicating that the Rule was not saved and the reason. "" Get &tab1; The quantity of Stock to be added to the Shopping List when the Rule is applied. &tab1; Get is required and must be a whole number between 1 and 9999 (0 is valid but is useless). &tab1; Clicking on SAVE with Get empty/invalid will result in a message indicating that the Rule was not saved and the reason. "" "" Prompt &tab1; If ticked the Rule will be a Prompted Rule requiring manual intervention to add or skip to apply or not apply respectively. &tab1; Prompt (ticking it) is according to what is required of the Rule. "" Starts &tab1; Starts is actually two fields that are alternative methods of specifying the Date that the Rule will be next applied. &tab2; The Date can either be selected by clicking on the button that displays the current Date thus using the Pick Date dialog, or the Date can be input into the field to the right of the button in dd/mm/yyyy format (e.g. 31/03/2010). &tab2; Note! inputting the Date takes precedence, i.e. if it is not blank then the date input will be used. However, selecting a Date via the Pick Date will clear the input date. &tab1; Starts is required but cannot not be provided. &tab2; If the date input is invalid, the Rule will not be saved and a message detailing the reason will be shown. No actions are available from the List, as this could be confusing due to recursion. "" Rules Suggest/Check Display - Help &heading;Rules Suggest/Check Display "" The Rules Suggest/Check Display Display is used by SUGGEST, CHECK and DISABLED to display potential Rule changes. &tab1; Note! DISABLED is only available if there are Rules that have been disabled (by the DISABLE button. When invoked by the Suggest button from the Tool Rules display the title will be Rule Suggestion List. When invoked by the Check button from the Tool Rules display the title will be Rule Accuracy Check List. Although the Displays appear markedly different they are basically the same. Differences other then the title are:- &tab1; SUGGEST has 3 buttons per item ADD, SKIP and DISABLE. &tab1; CHECK has 1 button per item MODIFY &tab1; CHECK also has a visual indicator of the accuracy of the Rule, at the top, per Item. &tab2; The visual indicator is a bar with two halves, one will be fully green the other may have some orange. &tab2; The left half is for indicating a Rule that results in too few of the Stock being purchased by the Rule (a percentage lower than 100). &tab2; The right half is for indicating a Rule that results in too many of the Stock being purchased by the Rule (a percentage higher than 100). &tab2; The amount of orange is an indication of how far from 100. If there is no orange then the Rule is 100 accurate. &tab1; Note! Rule Suggestion is only made for Stock/b> that does not have an associated Rule, whilst Rule Accuracy Check is for existing Rules. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Tool Rules Display.. "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will go to the Rules Add/Edit Display, as if adding BUT providing the suggested data as determined from shopping data. &tab2; Note! The suggested Rule Name will be the Product Name associated with the respective Stock prefixed with #. If you wish to know which Rules have been suggested the # could be left to identify them. &tab2; Note! The Interval of the suggested Rule will always be DAYS. "" SKIP &tab1; Clicking SKIP will remove the respective Rule from the list, but only temporarily. i.e. The next time SUGGEST is clicked the Rule will appear. "" DISABLE &tab1; Clicking DISABLE will remove the respective Rule from the list, until the Rule is enabled via the DISABLED option of the Tools Rules Display &tab2; Note! the Tools Rules Display DISABLEDoption is only available if there are disabled Rule Suggestions. &tab2; Note! it is actually the Stock that has been flagged as being excluded. Rule suggestion is solely for when a Rule does not exist for a Stock item. "" MODIFY &tab1; Clicking MODIFY (Rule Accuracy Check Display) will go to the Rule Add/Edit Display in Edit mode providing data according to the suggested modification. &tab2; The suggested modification being as per the text to the left of the button. (e.g. 1 per 3 days (31 in 118 days, 1 per 3.806)), will use an Interval of Days with a Multiplier of 3. "" ENABLE &tab1; Clicking ENABLE (Disabled Rule List Display) will re-enable a disabled rule suggestion. &tab1; Note if all disabled rules are enabled then a return will be made to the Tool Rules Display. "" &heading;Fields "" Top Row (below indicator for the Rule Accuracy Check Display). Rule Name (suggested Rule name for the Rule Suggestion List Display i.e. Product Name prefixed with #). Product Name associated with the Stock item. Shop Name associated with the Stock item. Middle Row (not including the indicator for the Rule Accuracy Check Display). Aisles\=Aisle Name associated with the Stock item. Existing Rule as text (only present for Rule Accuracy Check Display). Bottom Row. Suggested Rule based upon Shopping History. &tab1; All fields are for Display and cannot be altered. "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. No actions are available from the List, as this could be confusing due to recursion. "" Rule Tools Display - Help &heading;Rule Tools Display "" The Rule Tools Display Display is used to invoke the SUGGEST, CHECK and if available the DISABLED tools. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Tools Display. "" SUGGEST &tab1; Clicking SUGGEST will invoke the Rule Suggestion List Display that will suggest potential new Rules based upon Shopping Historical Data. "" CHECK &tab1; Clicking CHECK will invoke the Rule Accuracy Check List Display that will suggest potential changes to existing Rules based upon Shopping Historical Data. "" DISABLED &tab1; Clicking DISABLED will invoke the Disabled Rule List Display that allows disabled rule suggestions to be re-enabled. &tab2; Note! this button is only available if there are disabled rule suggestions. "" &heading;Fields "" Min Period &tab1; Min Period is the minimum period, in days, between the first and last period, for which Rules will be suggested or checked. &tab2; The default value is 30 days. The lower this value the less accurate/appropriate the suggestions may be with a greater number of suggestions or checks being made. The higher the value the more accurate/appropriate the suggestions may be with fewer suggestions or checks being made. &tab2; This has no impact when selecting the DISABLED option, if available. &tab1; required and must be a whole number between 1 and 9999. "" Min Bought &tab1; Min Bought is the minimum number of purchases of the respective Stock, for which Rules will be suggested or checked. &tab2; The default value is 5 purchases. The lower this value the less accurate/appropriate the suggestions may be with a greater number of suggestions or checks being made. The higher the value the more accurate/appropriate the suggestions may be with fewer suggestions or checks being made. &tab2; This has no impact when selecting the DISABLED option, if available. &tab1; required and must be a whole number between 1 and 9999. "" Shopping Display - Help &heading;Shopping Display "" The Shopping Display is used for doing the Shopping, it is the Shopping List "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Main Display.. "" TIDY &tab1; Clicking TIDY will removed checked-off items from the Shopping List, it will also adjust the underlying quantities to reflect no purchases, effectively removing any purchases made for accurate calculation of totals, amount spent and amount remaining to be spent. &tab1; TIDY is intended to be used to prepare for the next Shopping expedition leaving any outstanding purchases on the Shopping List. "" BOUGHT (per item/row that isn\'t checked-off) &tab1; Clicking BOUGHT will apply changes to reflect that 1 of the respective Stock has been purchased. &tab1; The amount remaining to purchase will be decreased by 1, underlying changes will also be made reflecting the purchase. &tab1; If the full number of purchases have been made for the respective Stock, it will be checked-off (text changes to white) and the BOUGHT button is hidden. "" ADJUST (per item/row) &tab1; Clicking ADJUST will go to the ADJUST Display allowing changes to be made to, the Product Name associated with the respective Stock, the Price of the Stock, the Quantity to Purchase and the Number Purchased. "" DELETE (per item/row) &tab1; Clicking DELETE will remove the respective Stock from the Shopping List. &tab2; Note! Total Cost, Spent and Remaining will be adjusted as if the Stock had never been on the Shopping List . &tab2; Note! DELETE is intended primarily for removing Stock that was inadvertently added.. "" &heading;Fields "" Heading at the Top &tab1; Total (amount to the right) displays the total cost of the Shopping. &tab1; Left (amount to the right) displays the amount remaining to complete purchasing all of the Shopping. &tab1; Spent (amount to the right) displays the amount spent purchasing the Shopping bought. "" Shop row (darkest rows below the heading). &tab1; Shop Name and Location of the Shop (City). "" Aisle (2nd darkest rows below the heading). &tab1; Aisle Name. "" Stock row (alternating lightest rows). &tab1; Product Name, Number to Buy, Price for 1, Price for all, buttons. "" &heading;List Actions The List cannot be sorted. No actions are available from the List other than clicking the buttons. "" Shopping Adjust Display - Help &heading;Adjust Display "" The Adjust Display is used to make adjustments when Shopping. The Product Name, Price of the Stock, the Quantity to buy and the Qauntity purchased, can all be changed. The most frequent change will be to the Price of the Stock. &tab1; Noting that Stock is the term used by ShopWise for a Product allocated to an Aisle (location) within a Shop. "" &heading;Buttons "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the Shopping Display. "" ADD &tab1; Clicking ADD will add 1 to the Quantity to be purchased. "" LESS &tab1; Clicking LESS will subtract 1 from Quantity to be purchased, if WQuantity is 1 or more (i.e. it will let Quantity go below 0) "" SAVE &tab1; Clicking SAVE will save changes. &tab2; If no changes have been made or changes cannot be saved, a message will be shown indicating this and the reason. "" UNDO &tab1; Clicking UNDO will change all fields back to their original values (i.e to when the Adjust Display was invoked). &tab2; IA message will be issued indicating that the values have been reset. "" &heading;Fields "" Above the ADD and LESS buttons (the original values). &tab1; Product displays the name of the Product of the respective Stock. &tab1; Price displays the price of the respective Stock. &tab1; Total displays the total price of the respective Stock that is to be purchased. &tab1; Quantity displays the number of the respective Stock that are to be purchased. &tab1; Purchased displays the number of the respective Stock that have been purchased. &tab1; requirement. "" Between the ADD and LESS buttons and the SAVE, UNDO and DONE buttons (the modifier fields). &tab1; Product allows the name of the Product of the respective Stock to be changed. &tab2; The name cannot be blank and is limited to 24 characters. &tab1; Price allows the price of the respective Stock to be changed. &tab2; The Price must be a valid real number (i.e. a decimal point is allowed). &tab1; Quantity allows the number of the respective Stock that are to be purchased to be changed. &tab2; Quantity is required and must be a valid whole number between 1 and 9999. &tab2; Quantity is complimentary to the ADD and LESS buttons. &tab1; Purchased allows the number of the respective Stock that have been purchased to be changed. &tab2; Purchased is required and must be a valid whole number between 0 and 9999. &tab2; Purchased cannot be greater than Quantity. &tab2; If Purchased is the same as Quantity the Stocck will become checked-off. &tab2; You can revert a checked-off Stock by either reducing Purchased or increasing Quantity. (i.e. if Quantity is greater than Purchased the Stock will not be checked-off.) "" Shops Display - Help &heading;Shops Display "" The Shops Display allows Shops; to be Added by clicking the ADD button, Shops to be Edited or Stocked (if applicable) by clicking a Shop in the list of current Shops, or for a Shop to be deleted by long-clicking a Shop in the list of current Shops. "" &heading;Buttons "" The ADD button goes to the Shops Add/Edit display where Shops can be added. "" The DONE button will return to the Main Display "" &heading;List Actions The Shop List can be sorted according to a heading (Shop or Order), clicking the same heading again will toggle between ascending and descending. An item in the list can be clicked, a dialog will appear with options, Cancel, Stock and Edit. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;STOCK is for assigning Products to Shops, the respective Shop will be selected. "" &tab2;STOCK will only be present if at least 1 Aisle and at least 1 Product exists. &tab2;Note! Stock can also be accessed via the STOCK option and via the AISLES and PRODUCTS options. "" &tab1;EDIT is for changing the details of an existing Shop "" An item in the list can be long-clicked, a dialog will appear with options, Cancel and Delete. "" &tab1;The Dialog, will include all the directly and indirectly referenced Items that would also need to be deleted. "" &tab1;The list of impacted Items may be quite extensive, as Asiles, Stock, Rules and Shopping List entries may be referenced by the Shop &tab1;CANCEL will return to the Shops Display doing nothing. &tab1;DELETE will DELETE the Shop and all referenced items and then return to the Shops Display. "" &tab2;BACKUPING UP THE DATABASE (TOOLS BACKUP) BEFORE DELETING A SHOP IS ADVISED. "" Shops Add/Edit Display - Help &heading;Shops Add/Edit Display "" The Shops Add/Edit Display is used to Add or Edit Shops. When invoked via Edit the Shop\'s data fields will be filled with the current data, allowing it to be changed. When invoked via Add the Shop\'s data fields will be blank, except the Order field which will be set to a suggested Order. "" &heading;Buttons "" SAVE &tab1; Clicking SAVE will attempt to save the Shop. &tab2; If the Shop cannot be saved an error message (yellow text) will indicate the issue. If the Shop was saved then a message (green text) will indicate this. "" DONE &tab1; Clicking DONE will return to the SHOPS Display.. &tab2; Note! Changes will not be applied if made after saving. "" &heading;Fields "" Shop Name &tab1; The name of the Shop (up to 24 characters) used to identify the Shop. &tab1; Required and cannot be blank. "" City &tab1; The location of the Shop (up to 24 characters) used to distinguish between Shop\'s with the same name e.g. when the shop is part of a chain. &tab1; Optional. "" Order &tab1; The Order in which the Shop will appear in the Shopping List. &tab1; Lower numbers appear first. &tab1; Required and must be a value between 1 and 99999. &tab1; A suggested number is provided when adding a Shop. The suggested number will be 1000 for the first Shop or 100 greater than the highest Shop Order. "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. No actions are available from the List, as this could be confusing due to recursion. "" Stock Add Display - Help &heading;Stock Add Display "" The Stock Add Display is used to add Stock, that is to associate a Product with an Aisle within a Shop. &tab1; i.e. Stock is purchasable. &tab1; It is feasible that a single product could have multiple uses as Stock e.g. Baked Beans could be sold in Shop A and also Shop B. rather than define Baked Beans twice (which can be done, although it could be confusing) two Stocks could be created (the price and other aspects would be unique to each.). "" &heading;Note! "" The Stock Add Display can be invoked from multiple displays: &tab1;From the Stock List Display by the ADD button, &tab1;From the Shops Display by clicking the list and selecting STOCK from the dialog, &tab1;From the Aisles Display by clicking the list and selecting STOCK from the dialog and &tab1;From the Products Display by clicking the list and selecting STOCK from the dialog. "" How the Stock Add Display was invoked, is apparent from the Title of the Display (if from Shops, Aisles or Products, the title will have the invoking display in brackets e.g. (from Shops)). Additionally the Stock Add Display will inherit the colours from the invoking Display. "" &heading;Buttons "" SAVE &tab1; Clicking SAVE will add the Stock, if it cannot be saved a message will be shown indicating the issue.. "" &heading;DropDown Selectors "" The Shop field is a DropDown selector allowing the Shop to be changed/selected. &tab1; Note! Only Shops that have Aisles are available for selction.. "" The Aisle field is a DropDown selector allowing the Aisle to be changed/selected. &tab1; Note! Only Aisles that are owned by the Shop selected in the Shop dropdown selector can be selected.. "" The Product field is a DropDown selector allowing the Product to be changed/selected. &tab1; Note! Products already assigned as Stock in the Shop/Aisle are not listed, thus preventing duplication of Stock. &tab1; Note! The Filter field compliments the Product dropdown selector by progressively reducing the listed Products. "" &heading;Fields "" Filter &tab1; The Filter field is to filter the Products available in the Product dropdown selector. &tab1; The data entered in the filter will immediately reduce the list of Products available :- &tab2; Entering a or A (case independent) will reduce the list to only show Products whose Product Name includes a (e.g. Lettuce would then not appear in the list). &tab2; Entering bak will reduce the list to only show products whose Product Name includes bak (Baked beans would appear, Lettuce and Banana would not). Price &tab1; Price is the cost of a single Product, it is used by the Shopping List in determining the Total Cost, the amount spent and amount remaining to be spent. &tab2; If there is no interest in the amounts shown in Shopping List, then price could be left at the default of 0.00. &tab1; Price is required and must be a real number, a decimal point can be used. If an invalid value is input and SAVE, the SAVE will be rejected and a message issued providing the reason. "" Order &tab1; Order is used for ordering the Stock within the Shopping List. The Order determines where in the Shopping List, within the respective Aisle, that the Stock appears. &tab1; Order is required and must be a whole number between 0 and 9999, lower numbers appear first in the list. &tab1; An Order is suggested, this being 1000 or 100 greater than the highest order within the Aisle. Thus it can be beneficial to add Stock in the order in which it is to be listed. "" Checklist &tab1; Checklist is used to specify if the Stock should appear in the CheckList. If ticked the Stock will appear in the CheckList. "" Level &tab1; Level is used to specify the level of Stock that should exist, it is a reminder that appears in the CheckList. &tab1; Level can be blank or a valid number. If blank then it will be changed to 1 the default value. "" &heading;List Actions The List can be sorted by clicking on a heading. Clicking the same heading toggles the sort order between ascending and descending. The List only displays Stock already assigned to the selected Shop/Aisle combination. An item in the list can be clicked, a dialog will appear with options, Cancel and Edit. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;EDIT is for changing the details of an existing Stock "" An item in the list can be long-clicked, a dialog will appear with options, CANCEL and DELETE. "" &tab1;CANCEL returns to the list doing nothing (you can also click outside of the dialog). "" &tab1;DELETE will delete the Stock (not the Product) along with items that reference the Stock. &tab2; Note! referenced items, that will be deleted, are displayed in the dialog.. "" Aisle &tab1; The Aisle field displays the name of the Aisle that the Stock is linked to, it cannot be altered.
